abstract: JPMorgan Chase posted earnings of $5.7 billion, up from $4.3 billion, as the bank showed signs of strength in consumer and corporate lending.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase posted earnings of $5.7 billion, up from $4.3 billion, as the bank showed signs of strength in consumer and corporate lending.
lead_paragraph: Finally moving beyond a trading debacle that has stained his once-stellar reputation, Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, on Friday trumpeted a strong quarter of earnings stemming from a surge in mortgage lending.

headline.main: Mortgage Lending Helps JPMorgan Profit Rise 34%
headline.print_headline: Mortgage Lending Helps JPMorgan Profit Rise 34%

abstract: JPMorgan Chase kicked off bank earnings season, announcing a 34 percent rise in profit. | Paul E. Singer, the head of Elliott Management, “may have met his match.” | When Timothy F. Geithner wants insight into Wall Street, he often turns to the head of BlackRock. | Workday is set to begin trading on the New York Stock Exchange.

lead_paragraph: JPMORGAN PROFIT RISES 34%  |  Bank earnings kick off Friday morning with JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo. With the broad economy showing signs of recovery, we’ll soon find out whether banks are feeling beneficial effects. Investors can expect the usual buzzwords — uncertainty, weak global economic conditions, the cost of new regulation — as banks explain their results.

abstract: For JPMorgan, a criminal case is being built on taped calls, but earnings are still rising. | Drawing back a curtain on a Mexican tycoon. | Andrew Ross Sorkin said France was welcoming back higher taxes, but not that high. | Ireland plans bold measures to lift housing. A look back on our reporting of the past week’s highs and lows in finance.

lead_paragraph: He may no longer be America’s least-hated banker, but Jamie Dimon still has the hearts of JPMorgan‘s investors.

headline.main: Week in Review: What Criminal Case? Inside JPMorgan’s Rising Profit
